title: Eve Energy to build battery factory in Hungary
notes:
Location:
- The battery cell manufacturing project is located in Debrecen, Hungary.

Capacity:
- The factory will have an annual capacity of 28 gigawatt-hours and is expected to go into operation in 2026.

Investment amounts:
- Eve Energy will invest around 400 billion forints (just over 1 billion euros) in the factory and create over 1,000 new jobs. The Hungarian government is supporting the construction with 14 billion forints, equivalent to about 38 million euros.

Project progress:
- Eve Energy had signed a non-binding letter of intent with the Debrecen Municipality to acquire 45 hectares in an industrial area and build a cylindrical cell production plant there. The factory is expected to be built on 45 hectares in the Northwest Economic Belt, reserved for BMW suppliers.

Project type:
- The project is a new build, with the factory being constructed from scratch.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will cover cell fabrication, where cathode and anode are combined with an electrolyte.

Note: The information does not specify the current operational capacity or the specific stages of the value chain covered at the facility.

title: Eve Power is building its first European plant in Debrecen
notes:
Location:
- The battery production project is located in Debrecen, Hungary, in the North-West Economic Zone reserved for BMW suppliers.

Capacity:
- The factory will have a production capacity of 28-gigawatt hours (GWh) per year.

Investment amounts:
- The investment for the project is about HUF 400 billion, with the state providing HUF 14 billion in support. Additionally, the government will finance new significant developments in the city, such as modernizing the water utility system in the amount of HUF 108 billion.

Project progress:
- The factory is planned to be built by 2026 on 45 hectares in the North-West Economic Zone reserved for BMW suppliers.

Project type:
- The project is a new build, as it will be constructed on a designated site.

Value chain stages:
- The company will produce high-performance battery cells with a diameter of 46 millimeters for electric BMWs, indicating that the project will cover cell fabrication. The company also has long-term cooperation with suppliers that produce some battery elements, such as cathode precursors and anodes, with green energy, suggesting that cathode and anode manufacturing may be included. However, there is no specific mention of module assembly.

title: EVE Formally Invests in Cylindrical Battery Project in Hungary and Acquires Land for New Project in Malaysia
notes:
Location:
- Hungary: Debrecen
- Malaysia: N/A

Capacity:
- Hungary: RMB 9.97 billion investment for a new production capacity of large-sized cylindrical Li-ion battery cells

Investment amounts:
- Hungary: RMB 9.97 billion investment for the project
- Malaysia: US$422.3 million (around RMB 3 billion) investment for the project

Project progress:
- Hungary: The project has been approved, and the subsidiary EVE Power Hungary Kft. will invest in setting up the plant in Debrecen.
- Malaysia: A land purchase agreement has been signed, and the project has been approved.

Project type:
- Hungary: New build for manufacturing cylindrical batteries used in electric passenger vehicles
- Malaysia: N/A

Value chain stages:
- Hungary: Cell fabrication for large-sized cylindrical Li-ion battery cells

Note: The article provides detailed information about EVE's expansion plans in Hungary and Malaysia, but specific details about the progress and type of project in Malaysia are not available.

title: EVE Energy to set up EV battery unit in Hungary
notes:
Location:
- The battery plant is planned to be built in Debrecen, Hungary.
